question.title: How to run chrome browser in headful mode in playwright-java remote server
question.body:
I am using the below command to start playwright server:

npx playwright launch-server --browser "chromium"

but it is headless.
How to run it in headful mode?

I also used the below command, to start the playwright server:

npx playwright run-server

My playwright-java code is below:

Browser browser = playwright.chromium().connect("ws://localhost:58379/");

but it is still executing in headless mode.

answers.body:
Easiest is to pass it as a parameter when launching the server:

npx playwright launch-server --browser=chromium --no-headless

To make it listen on a fixed port, add that as well:

npx playwright launch-server --browser=chromium --no-headless --port=58379

Note on run-server vs. launch-server:

  • run-server starts only the Playwright driver (no real browser) and is meant for internal/CLI use, so it always stays headless.
  • launch-server actually launches a browser process (Chromium / Firefox / WebKit) with whatever launch options you pass, then exposes its WebSocket endpoint for remote clients.
